meanings.definition: Burn or sear with a heated instrument or caustic substance to destroy tissue.
meanings.sent1: The doctor had to cauterise the wound to prevent infection.
meanings.sent2: In the past, they would cauterise wounds to stop bleeding.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally cauterised my shoelace on the hot iron!
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to cauterise his heart, leaving him feeling numb.
meanings.sent5: The image of the burning candle cauterising the paper was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To burn or sear a wound to stop bleeding or prevent infection.
meanings.sent1: The soldier had to quickly cauterise his wound on the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: It is important to cauterise a wound to avoid complications.
meanings.sent3: She decided to cauterise the cut on her finger with a hot spoon.
meanings.sent4: The harsh truth seemed to cauterise her emotions, leaving her feeling empty.
meanings.sent5: The smell of smoke filled the room as they cauterised the wound.
